title: Cryptomultiplier
author: Cryptomultiplier
content: We know that if we want to learn the basics of cryptocurrency or seeking higher level knowledge for investing in and trading digital money, Udemy, Edx, Coursera are online sites that offer a wide variety of cryptocurrency training courses that can teach one on what needs to be known. Some others do exist that teach the subject of cryptocurrency and give users the opportunity to try out or test what they have learnt while gaining certification as a Certified Blockchain Professional (CBP) or certification as a Certified Blockchain Developer (CBD).Another finding led me to discover that the University of Nicosia offers an MSc in Blockchain and Digital Currency and is notably among the first institution with such academic degree in this field and in the world.*If the study of fish is called fishery, what is the study of Bitcoin, cryptocurrency in general and the study of Blockchain technology called?

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptomultiplier on May 26, 2024, 01:04:52 PM*If the study of fish is called fishery, what is the study of Bitcoin or cryptocurrency in general and the study of Blockchain technology called?The study of fish is called ichthyology, a fishery is a place where fish are caught or a place where commercial raising happens.So first find the Latin or greek word for Bitcoin/Blockchain and slap an ology at the end!

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: Your topic to me seems to me that it should be in the off topic section. That's because it has no matter of discussion. I don't see much of discussion here. The term cryptocurrency and Blockchain technology, comprises of a wide range of field, studies and specialty. They are broad terms that can be used to describe so many other terms relating to digital currencies. I don't think there's any other thing one can use to describe the study of cryptocurrency aside cryptocurrency it self.( If I'm wrong, I'm open to correction guys)

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: This is actually a beautiful topic, and it has got many things to learn from it, ranging from what the study of Bitcoin, cryptocurrency and Blockchain been called. And I think I kind of agree to what Sir "Stompix" suggested to first find the Latin or greek word for Crypto/Bitcoin/Blockchain and slap an ology at the end.That is;1. Crypto in Greek = Kryptos, which means hidden). whereas if you are to slap an "ology" at the end, it gives us Kryptology. (I.e Cryptology, the study of Crypto)2. Bitcoin in Latin = "Solidus electronicus quidam", which means "A certain electronic coin"). whereas if you are to slap an "ology" at the end, it gives us Electronicus-quidamology (i.e the study of Bitcoin)3. Blockchain in Latin = "Bibliotheca electronica quaedam", which means a certain electronic library). whereas if you are to slap an "ology" at the end, it gives us Electronica-quaedamology (i.e the study of the Blockchain)But however, I also tried using a short cut with ChatGPT, and this is what I got üëáQuoteThe study of cryptocurrency is often referred to as "cryptoeconomics." This field combines elements of cryptography, computer science, economics, and game theory to analyze and understand the incentives, behavior, and mechanisms behind cryptocurrencies and blockchain technologies.Credit: ChatGPT
